title: Next-gen mobile internet — 6G — will launch in 2030, telecom bosses say, even as 5G adoption remains low
description: 6G, the next generation of mobile internet after 5G, is likely to launch in 2030, top telco executives told CNBC.

title: Treasury Secretary Yellen warns that losses tied to climate change could 'cascade through the financial system'
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said a "delayed and disorderly transition" to a net-zero emissions economy could create shocks to the financial system.

title: 'Our movement is unstoppable': Exiled Belarusian opposition leader speaks out after receiving 15-year prison sentence
description: A Minsk court on Monday, which convicted Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya in absentia, found her guilty of treason and conspiracy to seize power.

title: Fed Chair Powell says interest rates are 'likely to be higher' than previously anticipated
description: Citing earlier data showing that inflation has reversed the deceleration in late 2022, Powell warned of tighter monetary policy ahead.

title: Salesforce follows Microsoft in launching A.I. tools for salespeople with help from OpenAI
description: Having cutting-edge technology could boost revenue, but Salesforce isn't announcing prices for its new sales, marketing and service tools yet.

title: 'Let's bring France to a halt': Oil refineries blocked and trains halted by pension reform protests
description: Unions want to get two million people onto the streets and are turning to rolling strikes, as they protest plans to raise the pension age from 62 to 64.

title: BlackRock says European companies are showing 'surprise resilience' — and better value than the U.S.
description: European corporate earnings were surprisingly resilient in the fourth quarter of 2022, and the continent's stock outperformance of the U.S. looks set to continue, according to BlackRock.

title: Commercial real estate has a 'shock coming' as return-to-office plans fall short, CEO says
description: Offices in the future could work in a similar way to gas stations, Mark Dixon, CEO of flexible office company IWG, told CNBC.

title: How China's shifting growth picture could hit global markets
description: China's economy will be forced to recalibrate because of a "fractured" global order, and the new drivers of growth will "disappoint" global markets, according to David Roche.

title: Oil chief leading COP28 climate summit urges energy industry to 'up its game' to reduce emissions
description: The head of the United Arab Emirates' state oil company was seen as a controversial choice to lead the COP28 climate talks in Dubai later this year.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell to speak in Congress – markets are mixed on expectations
description: U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell will testify before Congress as a week packed with economic data releases lies ahead.

title: Womb for rent: More women are working as commercial surrogates as global demand rises
description: An increasing number of women are becoming commercial surrogates in countries such as Georgia and Mexico amid soaring global demand.

title: Meta planning thousands of more cuts after widespread layoffs, report says
description: The layoffs could begin this week and affect thousands of employees.

title: China denies Mark Mobius' claims that its government is restricting capital flow
description: Chinese authorities denied claims of billionaire investor Mark Mobius saying that he is unable to wire funds out of China due to government restrictions on capital flow.

title: China says U.S. relations have left rational path, warns of conflict unless they 'hit the brake'
description: Qin, who was until recently China's ambassador to the U.S., said China would "pursue a sound and stable relationship with the U.S."

title: Bank of America sees lithium surplus in 2023 as demand eases
description: She also said she expects China's electric vehicle demand growth to slow from 95% last year to 22% this year.

title: Singapore's tech salaries mostly jumped in 2022, new report shows
description: Tech salaries in Singapore mostly jumped in 2022 despite a string of tech layoffs and a slowdown in hiring.

title: Chinese smartphone giants are making a high-end play against Apple and Samsung
description: Chinese smartphone makers are looking to push into the high-end device market to challenge the dominance of Apple and Samsung.
